name: Education is a Priority
title: Top Investment in Primary Education
description: In 2015, Serbia's government expenditure per student in primary education was 43.65% of GDP per capita, showcasing a strong commitment to education.

name: Empowered Women
title: Leading in Women's Health Autonomy
description: In 2019, 96.2% of Serbian women aged 15-49 made informed decisions regarding sexual relations, contraceptive use, and reproductive health care, highlighting significant progress in women's rights.

name: Safe and Sound
title: Low Injury-Related Deaths
description: In 2019, only 2.37% of deaths in Serbia were due to injuries, indicating a relatively safe environment for its citizens.

name: Poverty Almost Eradicated
title: Minimal Multidimensional Poverty
description: By 2019, Serbia had reduced its multidimensional poverty headcount ratio to just 0.1% of the population, reflecting effective poverty alleviation strategies.

name: Aid Challenges
title: Negative Net Aid Flows
description: In 2022, Serbia experienced a negative net bilateral aid flow of -$4,099,999.90 from Finland, indicating challenges in international aid relations.

name: UN Support Lacking
title: Minimal Official UN Flows
description: In 2015, Serbia received a minimal net official flow of -$961.99 from UNECE, highlighting limited support from UN agencies.
